alert.note: Alert for Clackamas; Multnomah (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 12:58PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Oregon, Clackamas, Multnomah and Washington. In southwest Washington, Clark. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1257 PM PST, the public reported rain and localized ponding of water in the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hillsboro, Oregon City, Battle Ground, Washougal, Portland Downtown, Vancouver Downtown, Portland, Vancouver, Gresham, Beaverton, Tigard, Lake Oswego, Tualatin, West Linn, Forest Grove, Milwaukie, Wilsonville, Camas, Troutdale and Gladstone. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
